channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Twitter sued Elon Musk over his attempt to walk away from his $44 billion takeover bid, seeking to force the billionaire to honor the terms of the deal #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/Abf08NLMel
Costco is eating the higher costs of its popular $1.50 hot dog and soda combo so customers don’t have to. Its price has stayed the same since 1985. https://t.co/rZyE86EJRl
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/L4sNzp7XZh

Ukrainian forces struck an air-defense system in Russian-occupied territory in the east of the country late Tuesday, in the latest sign of how long-range artillery sent by the West is shifting the war’s calculus https://t.co/lIyok63lSO
Fascinated by NASA’s newly-released James Webb Telescope images but not sure exactly what you’re looking at? Here’s a guide https://t.co/QqLDXGKUI5
Crypto lender Celsius has filed for bankruptcy protection a month after it froze customer withdrawals in the wake of a collapse in digital currency prices https://t.co/P89kkSJRI3
A federal jury found Joshua Schulte, an ex-CIA software engineer, guilty of transmitting national defense information to WikiLeaks https://t.co/SmnlHkfwq0

From @WSJopinion: Russia has at least 10 times as many artillery and missile systems as Ukraine. The West has been too slow, and the need to even out the artillery disparity is urgent, writes @JillianKayM. https://t.co/HMpId1E470
Tesla supplier Panasonic says it plans to build a $4 billion electric vehicle battery factory in Kansas https://t.co/ZX6yhRyH6G
From Wednesday until Friday, the moon will be full while at its closest point to Earth, creating what is known as a “supermoon” https://t.co/T5xQlYzOvO
Psychedelics like LSD, magic mushrooms and MDMA are making the jump from party drugs to prescription drugs–and more investors are noticing https://t.co/DfrXhn0Crg

Residents in Uvalde, Texas, are expressing their anger after a leaked video showed police waiting in the hallway of Robb Elementary School for more than an hour before entering a classroom where a gunman killed 21 people https://t.co/C7O4haUGOf
Breaking: Pharmacists who refuse to fill prescriptions for drugs used in abortions might violate antidiscrimination law, the Biden administration says https://t.co/KGEvVJztku
Fascinated by NASA’s newly-released James Webb Telescope images but not sure exactly what you’re looking at? Here’s a guide https://t.co/A4WRtLbLjS

Former President Donald Trump tried to contact a witness in the House select committee investigation of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol, the committee Vice Chairwoman Liz Cheney said https://t.co/URAnbw1UMs

Microsoft is cutting a small percentage of its workforce, while rapid-delivery startup Gopuff says it is cutting 10% of its workforce, the latest in a string of layoffs by high-profile tech companies https://t.co/xq1JqE5GQN
The U.S. military conducted a drone strike that killed the top Islamic State leader in Syria and injured one other terrorist operative, U.S. Central Command said https://t.co/BQldKC6KFg
U.S. inflation reached 9.1% in June, its highest rate in nearly 41 years https://t.co/c5D9I05a59

The James Webb Space Telescope is able to capture images of older and more distant galaxies, giving astronomers a peek into how the universe took shape nearly 14 billion years ago. Here's a closer look at what the images reveal. https://t.co/EX5P7s6riB
Google will slow hiring for the rest of the year, CEO Sundar Pichai told employees, making it the latest tech company to either pull back on new hires or trim staff https://t.co/godWqIjXFI
Walmart has agreed to buy a fleet of Canoo's forthcoming electric delivery vehicles as the retail giant looks to bolster its e-commerce delivery service https://t.co/apScnhqOPE
A new PBS documentary explains how the James Webb Space Telescope, whose first images have just been released and is the most powerful instrument of its kind ever, came to be https://t.co/SWu9zvbpIO
Elon Musk said he thinks it's time for former President Donald Trump "to hang up his hat & sail into the sunset" https://t.co/TC5yT384yZ

South Carolina prosecutors intend to seek murder indictments later this week against disgraced lawyer Alex Murdaugh for the deaths of his wife, Maggie, and son Paul, Murdaugh’s lawyer announced https://t.co/MaTa9lTFlw

From @WSJopinion: The moral and political confusion of the contemporary West is the secret weapon that the leaders of Russia and China believe will bring the American world order to its knees, writes @wrmead https://t.co/VUT9g2YITt

Two investors bought a bottle of champagne with digital tokens attached for $2.5 million, likely breaking the record for the most expensive wine in history. And they don't plan to pop the cork. "I think it will be a good investment." https://t.co/YPvPANhc9t
Crowds paid their respects to former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe as his coffin was driven past Parliament on the day of his funeral https://t.co/Pi2kyxrRQu

The James Webb Space Telescope is able to capture images of older and more distant galaxies, giving astronomers a peek into how the universe took shape nearly 14 billion years ago. Here's a closer look at what the images reveal. https://t.co/goDJPgMYkt
Breaking: Twitter is suing Elon Musk over his attempt to walk away from the $44 billion takeover bid, seeking to force him to honor the terms of the deal https://t.co/lCSkANcpn0
NASA released the first set of scientific images from the James Webb Space Telescope, peering deeper into space—and further back in time—than has ever before been possible https://t.co/3cRUOfo3PR
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/lxRfRvGwFO
Tesla Chief Executive Elon Musk said he thinks it is time for former President Donald Trump ‘to hang up his hat & sail into the sunset’ https://t.co/zzagfPbDGE
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/FY2ajbZlPH https://t.co/agDS8iYWDD
From @WSJopinion: Elon Musk’s decision to call off his purchase of Twitter is a loss for the social-media site as well as for political free speech https://t.co/Ub1u7kEP4K
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/PtvwIEOtCY
Iran is preparing to provide Russia with drones for the battlefield in Ukraine, as well as training for its forces to use them, a senior White House official said Monday https://t.co/FYfQbYYfHq
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of Tuesday's unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/mr2xULjo59

From @WSJopinion: Pete Buttigieg is running rough-shod over the Constitution’s separation of powers. But at least the Justices have now empowered lower courts to stop him, and let’s hope they do. https://t.co/xz8ZXCOVux
The U.S. government said hospitals must provide abortions to stabilize patients in emergency situations, regardless of state law https://t.co/9lfEHCtCnf
Twitter sent a letter to Elon Musk saying his effort to abandon his $44 billion takeover is “invalid and wrongful” and that Twitter hasn’t breached any of its obligations https://t.co/zdBNc8yBhf

Companies are considering more cuts to their office space as they face an uncertain economic outlook. “Mondays are pretty empty. Fridays are pretty empty. And that means we have too much real estate.” https://t.co/neExo40gQ6
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/1hUDg503Ym https://t.co/71Ck2MPNsM
Breaking: The Justice Department is investigating whether the PGA Tour engaged in anticompetitive actions as it battles the Saudi-backed LIV Golf league https://t.co/GCaemU6gPQ

The Justice Department said Steve Bannon’s offer to testify to the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol is no reason for him to avoid trial for defying the committee’s subpoena seeking testimony and documents https://t.co/0PHHQqChDg
The U.K. is helping Ukraine turn civilians into soldiers, training new recruits to give Kyiv more manpower along the eastern front with Russia https://t.co/Fq1dx6WzE1

Novak Djokovic has had his share of on-court implosions, but Sunday at Wimbledon versus Nick Kyrgios, he was a picture of serenity–and won his 21st major tournament title, writes @jasongay https://t.co/oDZevaNulm

Since the pandemic began, workers and employers moved from Democratic-leaning states to Republican-leaning ones in the middle of the country and Florida, spurring faster economic recoveries there #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/UXakS2yamO https://t.co/oMd1A6NIaW
Forget beaches. Miami is all about hedge funds and crypto now. https://t.co/ZgOwixiDM9

Sri Lanka’s president and prime minister agreed to resign after protesters stormed and occupied the president’s residence, amid public anger over the country’s deepening sovereign debt crisis https://t.co/Mc21c7wnm1
NASA released a dazzling test image taken by the James Webb Space Telescope in advance of Tuesday's unveiling of its first full-color scientific images https://t.co/oAXBT6iVmk
